document.masterDocTitle: Catalogue and Bibliography of the Hong Kong Carabidae Latreille, 1802 (Coleoptera: Adephaga), with notes on the historic boundaries of Hong Kong as related to zoological collections

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Catalogue and Bibliography of the Hong Kong Carabidae Latreille, 1802 (Coleoptera: Adephaga), with notes on the historic boundaries of Hong Kong as related to zoological collections

bibRefCitation.author: Chaudoir
bibRefCitation.refString: Chaudoir, M. de (1856) Memoire sur la famille des Carabiques. 6 e partie. Bulletin de la Societe Imperiale des Naturalistes de Moscou, 29 (3), 187 - 291.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Chaudoir described this species from Hong Kong specimens, he acquired from Schaum. Also listed as occurring in Hong Kong by
Chaudoir ( 1876 b)
,
Gemminger & Harold ( 1868 )
,
Bates ( 1873 a)
and Kirschenhofer ( 2014 ). Biology :
Chaudoir ( 1876 b)
notes that this was a common species in Hong Kong , though appears not to be so now.

bibRefCitation.author: Laporte
bibRefCitation.refString: Laporte, F. L. N. de [comte de Castelnau] (1834) Etudes entomologiques, ou description d'insects nouveaux; et observations sur leur synonymie. Mequignon-Marvis, Paris, 94 pp. *

subSubSection.paragraph:
A junior synonym of this species,
Chlaenius nigricoxis
Motschulsky 1865
, was described from specimens originating in Hong Kong and was listed by
Gemminger & Harold ( 1868 )
,
Chaudoir ( 1876 b)
and
Bates ( 1892 )
under that name as occurring in Hong Kong .
Andrewes ( 1919 a)
,
Lee & Winney ( 1981 )
,
Hua ( 2002 )
,
Kirschenhofer ( 2003 a)
list this species for Hong Kong . Material : Sight record 1 ex. W.T.L.,
9 .iv. 14
; Sight record ♀ W.T.L.,
11 .iv. 14
; Sight record ♀ W.T.L.,
1 .iv. 14
; 1 ex. W.T.L.,
16 .iv. 13
; 1 ex. W.T.L.,
30 .iv. 11
; 1 ex.
1 .v. 11
; sight record W.T.L.,
7 .v. 13
; 1 ex. Hong Kong , Sha Lo Tung,
28-31 .v. 2015
, Winkler extractor, Leg. R.Ho Lee & Y.Luo; 1 ex. Hong Kong , Pak Tam Chung,
5-8 .vi. 15
, pitfall trap, Leg. R.Ho Lee & Y.Luo; 1 ex. Hong Kong ,
2 .viii.07
(Leg. Yiu Vo). Biology : Imago found April to August. Can be attracted to light, it is fully winged and capable of flight. Most surprisingly for such a large species, can be caught in both pitfall traps and Winkler extractor.
Subgenus
Lissauchenius
W.S. MacLeay, 1825

Chaudoir described
Chlaenius lynx
from a Hong Kong specimen given to him by Dohrn.
Redtenbacher ( 1867 )
recorded
Chlaenius bimaculatus
Dejean 1826
from Hong Kong , though Andrewes ( 1924 ) determined Redtenbacher's specimen as
Chlaenius lynx
Chaudoir 1856
. Listed as occurring in Hong Kong by
Gemminger & Harold ( 1868 )
,
Chaudoir ( 1876 b)
and
Park et.al. ( 2006 )
.
Mandl ( 1983 )
and
Kirschenhofer ( 1997
&
2003 a
) list this taxa as
Chlaenius ( Lissauchenius ) rufifemoratus lynx
Chaudoir 1856
, and make no mention of
bimaculatus .
Material : 1 ex. Hong Kong , Lantau, Pui O,
20 .ii. 15
; Sight record W.T.L.,
28 .iv. 15
; Ƌ & ♀W.T.L.,
12 .v. 15
; 1 ex. Hong Kong ,
23 .v.07
(Leg. Yiu Vor); 1 ex. Hong Kong , Lam Tsuen valley,
2 .vi. 12
netted from bushes close to stream; 1 ex. W.T.L.,
6 .vi. 13
; 1 ex. W.T.,
16 .vii. 13
, netted from grass on river bank; Ƌ W.T.L.,
7 .viii. 13
; Ƌ W.T.L.,
20 .viii. 13
; Ƌ W.T.L.,
20 .viii. 13
; 1 ex. Hong Kong , Kam Tin,
29 .viii.07
(Leg. Yiu Vor); Sight record ♀ W.T.L.,
28 .viii. 14
; Ƌ W.T.L.,
27 .ix. 14
. Biology : Imago found February to September. It seems to live in well vegetated areas, probably close to water. Can be attracted to light, it is fully winged and capable of flight.

New record for Hong Kong .
Chaudoir ( 1876 b)
originally described this species from what is now Indonesia . The macula at the apex of the elytra is very variable in shape from almost circular to a transverse linear line. Material: Ƌ W.T.L.,

. Biology : Imago March to July. It seems to live in areas with good tree coverage. Can be attracted to light, it is fully winged and capable of flight.
